conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force on the ν-shaped wire in a uniform magnetic field.
Wire is bent into a ν-shape with equal side lengths and a 60° angle, placed in a magnetic field perpendicular to its plane.
Magnetic induction intensity is B and current intensity is I.
Wire is bent into a ν-shape with equal side lengths and a 60° angle.
Two sides of the ν-shape form a 60° angle with each other.
Total length of the wire is 2l, each part has a length of l.
Projection of each segment on the direction of the magnetic field is l cos(30°) = l √3/2.
Total effective length of the wire in the magnetic field is l√3.
Magnetic force on a current-carrying wire is F = B I L sin θ.
Length of the wire in the magnetic field is l√3 and angle between current and magnetic field is 90°.
Magnetic force is F = B I (l√3) sin 90° = B I l√3.
Magnitude of the Ampere force is B I l √3.
